item.title: Kaijsa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kaijsa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kaijsa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Kaijsa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they had really happened and after you are finished reading one you will feel that all that happened to you and afterwards it all belongs to you: the good and the bad, the ecstasy, the remorse and sorrow, the people and the places and how the weather was. If you can get so that you can give that to people, then you are a writer." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Kaijsa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "It is awfully easy to be hard-boiled about everything in the daytime, but at night it is another thing." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Kaijsa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "When you start to live outside yourself, it's all dangerous." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Kaijsa add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "We accept the love we think we deserve." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Kaijsa add a quote by Neil deGrasse Tyson
item.description: "The good thing about science is that it's true whether or not you believe in it." -- Neil deGrasse Tyson
